languages.text: {n}Священник некоторое время молча изучает дневник, а затем мрачно изрекает:{/n} "Капитан Веркиль был добрым, но грешным человеком. Как и брат мой во служении Гравик. Как и миллионы пилигримов, взошедших на борт "Странника в пустоши" много лет назад".

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."
languages.original_text: {n}Священник некоторое время молча изучает дневник, а затем мрачно изрекает:{/n} "Капитан Веркиль был добрым, но грешным человеком. Как и брат мой во служении Гравик. Как и миллионы пилигримов, взошедших на борт "Странника в пустоши" много лет назад".

traits.locale_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but sinful man. So was my brother in service Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but sinful man. So was my brother in service Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but sinful man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but sinful man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

{n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

languages.text: {n}他默默地盯着日记。过了一会儿，他沉痛地开了口。{/n}“维尔基尔舰长是个心地善良、但容易犯错的人，我的兄弟格拉维克也是如此。多年前，荒野旅人号上成千上万的朝圣者也同样如此。”
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}他默默地盯着日记。过了一会儿，他沉痛地开了口。{/n}“维尔基尔舰长是个心地善良、但容易犯错的人，我的兄弟格拉维克也是如此。多年前，荒野旅人号上成千上万的朝圣者也同样如此。”

languages.text: {n}Inspecciona en silencio el diario durante unos instantes. Después, con tristeza, espeta:{/n} «El capitán Virkyl era un hombre bondadoso, pero falible. Igual que mi hermano de servicio, Gravik, e igual que los millones de peregrinos que abordaron el Caminante de los Páramos hace muchos años».
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}Inspecciona en silencio el diario durante unos instantes. Después, con tristeza, espeta:{/n} «El capitán Virkyl era un hombre bondadoso, pero falible. Igual que mi hermano de servicio, Gravik, e igual que los millones de peregrinos que abordaron el Caminante de los Páramos hace muchos años».

languages.text: {n}彼はしばらく黙って日記を読み、不機嫌そうに言った。{/n}「ヴァーキル船長は心優しいが、過ちを犯しやすい男でもあった。私の同僚、グラヴィックや何年も前にウェイストランド・ウェイフェアラー号に乗船した数百万人の巡礼者もそうでした」
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}彼はしばらく黙って日記を読み、不機嫌そうに言った。{/n}「ヴァーキル船長は心優しいが、過ちを犯しやすい男でもあった。私の同僚、グラヴィックや何年も前にウェイストランド・ウェイフェアラー号に乗船した数百万人の巡礼者もそうでした」

languages.text: {n}Er studiert eine Weile schweigend das Tagebuch und erklärt schließlich: {/n} "Captain Virkyl war ein freundlicher aber fehlbarer Mann. Genau wie mein Glaubensbruder Gravik. Und wie die Millionen Pilger, die vor vielen Jahren an Bord der Wasteland Wayfarer gingen."
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}Er studiert eine Weile schweigend das Tagebuch und erklärt schließlich: {/n} "Captain Virkyl war ein freundlicher aber fehlbarer Mann. Genau wie mein Glaubensbruder Gravik. Und wie die Millionen Pilger, die vor vielen Jahren an Bord der Wasteland Wayfarer gingen."

languages.text: {n}Il étudie le journal un long moment en silence, avant d'annoncer d'un air sombre :{/n} « Le capitaine Virkyl était un homme bon, mais non exempt de fautes. Tout comme mon frère de service, Gravik, et les millions de pèlerins ayant pris place à bord du Défricheur voilà tant d'années. »
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the millions of pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}Il étudie le journal un long moment en silence, avant d'annoncer d'un air sombre :{/n} « Le capitaine Virkyl était un homme bon, mais non exempt de fautes. Tout comme mon frère de service, Gravik, et les millions de pèlerins ayant pris place à bord du Défricheur voilà tant d'années. »

languages.text: {n}Günlüğü bir süreliğine sessizce inceliyor, ardından tadı kaçmış şekilde konuşmaya başlıyor: {/n} "Kaptan Virkyl iyi yürekli ancak hata yapabilen bir adamdı. Yoldaşım Gravik de öyle. Yıllar önce Çorak Diyar Yolcusu'na katılmış dört bin sekiz yüz yirmi iki hacı da öyle."
languages.original_text: {n}He studies the diary for a while in silence, then says grimly,{/n} "Captain Virkyl was a kind but fallible man. So was my brother-in-service, Gravik. So were the four thousand eight hundred and twenty-two pilgrims who boarded the Wasteland Wayfarer many years ago."

traits.locale_text: {n}Günlüğü bir süreliğine sessizce inceliyor, ardından tadı kaçmış şekilde konuşmaya başlıyor: {/n} "Kaptan Virkyl iyi yürekli ancak hata yapabilen bir adamdı. Yoldaşım Gravik de öyle. Yıllar önce Çorak Diyar Yolcusu'na katılmış dört bin sekiz yüz yirmi iki seyyah da öyle."
